Logger

Copyright 2018-2019 The MathWorks Inc.

Create the logger

logName = 'demolog';
log = uiw.tool.Logger(logName,...
'BufferSize',50,...
'FileLevel','debug',...
'DisplayLevel','warning',...
'Callback',@(h,e)disp(e))

Log a warning

log.write('warning','My Warning Message');

Log an error

log.write('error','My Error Message');

Log an error and store the resulting message

msg = log.write('error','This error goes to a dialog');

Rethrow error as a dialog window (useful in an app) with optional title & options

opts = struct('WindowStyle','normal','Interpreter','none');
msg.toDialog('Optional Title', opts)
% You could also simply throw a modal dialog this way, and use the default title and options:
% msg.toDialog()

Log a debug message

This is within 'FileLevel' but not 'DisplayLevel', so it will go to the log file but not the command window
msg2 = log.write('debug','This is a debugging message.');

Log a message that we want to show the user

msg3 = log.write('user','This message is for the user.');

Throw to dialog

%opts = struct('WindowStyle','modal','Interpreter','none'); %These are the defaults
opts = struct('WindowStyle','normal','Interpreter','tex'); %These are non-defaults
msg3.toDialog('Message Title', opts)
